results.doc_title: Influencer MP Sprint Review - 2025/12/04 16:24 CET - Notes by Gemini
results.meeting_purpose: Sprint review for Influencer MP (Marketplace) project focusing on creator research status, customer validation planning, and prototype critique for validation testing

decisions.what: Use pitch deck with specific UI features instead of complete prototype for concept validation
decisions.context: To guide conversation and answer research questions while avoiding complexity of sign-up and storefront creation flows

decisions.what: Exclude sign-up and storefront creation flow from prototype
decisions.context: Due to complexity and potential distraction from core validation goals

decisions.what: Focus customer research on HelloFresh prospects actively engaging with food content on social media
decisions.context: For efficiency, as unmoderated results showed no major differences between prospects and active customers

decisions.what: Do not query creators about pricing models during interviews
decisions.context: Creators would only answer 'as much as possible' and platform must align creator and HelloFresh incentives

decisions.what: Initially give creators larger share of profit
decisions.context: To align creator and HelloFresh incentives in the platform

action_items.task: Complete concept validation interviews with creators
Conduct customer interviews focusing on inspiration execution gap, marketplace value, and trust barriers
action_items.timeline: Pilot by end of week, starting early this week

action_items.task: Continue recruitment focusing on larger influencers and cookbook authors
Discuss smoke testing and ABC testing possibilities with Andrea and Mark
Finish concept test research and provide recommendations
Identify who will drive MVP recruitment
Involve legal for contract creation with influencers
Handle minor tests with existing HelloFresh menu influencers

key_points: Five creator interviews completed covering creators up to 1.2M followers with consistent insights
Cookbook author saw no conflict using cookbook recipes on platform and aligned with commission-based compensation
Research transitioning to focus on cookbook authors and higher-level influencers
Creators interested in data: user interests, popular ingredients, cooking time, site traffic
Survey showed significant inspiration execution gap for customers
Customer research will use 30-minute interviews covering creator dynamics, cooking behavior, trust, vetting, accountability, and marketplace utility
Two core pricing approaches discussed: (1) HelloFresh charges service fee, creator sets price and margin; (2) HelloFresh sets consumer price (cost plus) with prescribed creator margin
Linnea Siersma and Ian Brooks favor model where creators set their own margin
Sameer Doda proposed tiered, cost-plus pricing based on influencer following size
System expected to be self-correcting as high prices or low quality would deter buyers
Quality assurance features include AI tool to review recipes and potential HelloFresh chef vetting
Creators interested in analytics, creating menus/meal plans, and customer engagement features
Community features proposed: rating, recipe modification, live cooking events

blockers.issue: Ingredient availability timing unclear - need to determine if ingredients must be in warehouse when recipe published and if they need to be reserved
Ingredient pricing stability concerns - unclear if prices would change over time due to shortages
Recipe card approach for Canada unclear - printed vs digital, translation technology (Concord)
Ownership of managing influencers for platform (legal aspects, issue handling) needs to be addressed
Concern about moving too quickly towards building before establishing product-market fit
Critical concern about MVP recruitment - who will drive this effort

follow_ups: Determine pricing model approach (creator-set margin vs. cost-plus vs. tiered)
Explore reusing code from other teams for recipe import feature
Test attributes of ingredients creators need to select (gram weight, form factor)
Determine if recipe cards can be branded for influencers
Decide if 'vetted by HelloFresh' should be premium offering or paid service
Finalize analytics tools to offer creators (avoiding Shopify-level complexity)
Explore smoke testing and ABC testing to address product-market fit concerns
Determine revenue model evolution and how to treat initial influencers
Clarify broader influencer program management ownership beyond Cole Banning's team capacity
